sub_title: Co-Founder | Executive Director | Diaspora Renaissance Initiative

school.name: University of South Africa/Universiteit van Suid-Afrika
Ecole Normale Supérieure, Université de Yaoundé, Cameroun

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Letters and Social Sciences

profile_positions.description:
In the absence of the regular teacher, I step-in to ensure the continuation of the lessons for pupils and thus the attainment of the overall curriculum goals. My responsibilities entail the overall management of the classes, including the maintenance of discipline, overseeing the completion of school assignments by students, tutoring, in accordance with the directions of the regular teacher. I perform my duties, which are both challenging and rewarding, with students from the High, Middle and Elementary School levels as well as kindergarten and with those with special needs.
My background and experience as trained High School Teacher allow me to meet and exceed the expectations of the position.
profile_positions.title: Long Term Substitute Teacher

profile_positions.description:
This non-for-profit organization reaches out to the African Diasporas at large, in order to facilitate the structuring and fostering of their contributions to the full awakening of Africa. 
Diaspora Renaissance has established and currently manages a fund whose mandate is to contribute to building African capacity in international ventures by sponsoring and otherwise facilitating the placement of young Africans in internships, fellowships, volunteer and comparable programs in international ventures. The fund aims at building intergenerational networks by providing African professionals and friends of Africa in international ventures with the opportunity of extending support to younger African generations. 
As Executive Director, my role has been to build the institutional and operational foundations of the organization and, thus, to convert this vision into a reality. To date, the Diaspora Renaissance’s Fellowship Fund has sponsored and facilitated the placement of numerous young Africans in international ventures, mainly in international organizations of the United Nations system.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
The main objective of the Kilimanjaro Initiative (KI) is to encourage young people from disadvantaged backgrounds to build self-confidence including by providing them with opportunities to become change agents in their communities. In its decade of existence, KI has organized annual climbs of Mount Kilimanjaro, which have involved over 500 participants, including 220 youth from Africa and beyond.
While residing in Kenya, I served as liaison between the Council and some international organizations based in Nairobi. I also designed and implemented partnerships between Kilimanjaro Initiative and some international schools in Kenya and in Europe. I facilitated the organization of sporting events between students of International Schools and youth from disadvantaged communities in Kenya. I contributed to the organization of KI’s flagship event, the annual climb of Mount Kilimanjaro, carried out in 2012 in partnership with UNWomen and the United Nations Federal Credit Union.
profile_positions.title: Director

company.name: Agency for Cooperation and Research in Development

profile_positions.company: Agency for Cooperation and Research in Development
profile_positions.description: Translated from English into French documents covering a wide range of subjects, including: project funding applications; public information materials; terms of reference for consultants; agreements between ACORD and donors; etc.
profile_positions.title: Translator

profile_positions.description: My achievements for this great assignment include: (1) the successful organization of the Consultative meeting on the Mainstreaming Environment and Sustainability in African Universities Partnership (MESA). The meeting brought together select academia from Africa and from China as well as representatives of the United Nations Environment Programme. The forum provided a platform to share experiences and develop a mechanism for collaboration in order to catalyze accelerated achievement of sustainable development goals in Africa and Asia as a tangible example of South-South collaboration. (2) Successful holding of the meeting on a Global Universities Partnership on Environment and Sustainability (GUPES). The GUPES meeting brought together university professors and administrators from a wide range of disciplines and fields related to environment and sustainable development mandated to identify global priority areas in environment and sustainability policy and research initiatives; define the agenda for the GUPES in universities and other institutions of higher education; set up operational modalities for GUPES to align with UNEP's activities with universities and partners. (3) Drafting the reports of the two meetings which are now UNEP official documents. I further developed an implementation strategy for the newly established GUPES. The implementation strategy suggested initial approaches to implementing the outcomes of the meeting. This strategy was organized around the institutional development of GUPES including issues related to its legal status and governance, the mainstreaming of GUPES into the Rio+20 process and towards a GUPES Strategy Document and Action Plan. It formed the basis for the activities for the Interim Steering Committee of GUPES and for UNEP in its education related activities, especially in the framework of the Rio+20 World Conference on the Environment and Development.
profile_positions.title: Environmental Education Consultant

profile_positions.description: Responsible for strategy development, implementation and reporting, I was involved in setting up the company and in the negotiation of its initial deals including (i) the provision advisory and executive services to a diplomatic mission in South Africa; (ii) the intermediation between Cameroonian and South-African businesses in the fields of real estate and education.
profile_positions.title: Managing Consultant

company.name: United Nations International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda

profile_positions.company: United Nations International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda
profile_positions.description:
Carried out programmatic/administrative tasks necessary for the functioning of a prosecution trial team including monitoring of performance parameters and critical indicators. In this regard, I planned and participated in strategy meetings; collected, organized and assembled exhibits, reviewed documents prior to their delivery to the defense counsel for disclosure. The administrative support provided to the Prosecution team (liaison with translation services, recruitment, retrieval of data from evidentiary databases, etc.) allowed it to win landmark cases in the field of international criminal law.

Similar functions were carried out in the same team between August and December 2003.
profile_positions.title: Case Manager

company.name: Office of the Special Representative of the UN Secretary-General for the Great Lakes

profile_positions.company: Office of the Special Representative of the UN Secretary-General for the Great Lakes
profile_positions.description: Reviewed the proceedings (English and French) of the various Regional Inter Ministerial Meetings and Regional Preparatory Committee Meetings of the Conference on Peace, Security and Development in the Great Lakes Region. Produced the English and French transcriptions of the proceedings of those meetings, translated portions of the proceedings from French into English and vice-versa. Compiled and formatted the proceedings for filing as official documents of the Conference. Provided advice on issues related to the long-term preservation and conservation of the proceedings of the Conference.
profile_positions.title: Report Drafting Consultant

company.name: UN International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda

profile_positions.company: UN International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda
profile_positions.description:
Reviewed English and French transcripts of the court proceedings as well as Orders for protective measures for witnesses in order to look for information which may lead to the identification of protected witnesses. Edited  transcripts in conformity with court orders. Proofread transcripts edited by other redactors against established editing guidelines and practices in view of the authentication of the transcripts and posting on the Tribunal's website. Interacted with other sections/units of the Registry in order to design and implement plans related  the transcripts processing chain. Prepared analytical reports on the assignments undertaken.

Performed similar duties from October 2002 to February 2003.
profile_positions.title: Verbatim Transcripts Analyst/Redactor

volunteer_experiences.description: In 2016 and 2017, I was a member of the organizing team of the first Walk of Hope initiative which took place in The Hague, The Netherlands in March 2017. The initiative aims at spreading the message of non-violence, tolerance and peace among the participants and in priority the Youth, particularly school and college children. With its motto: “Oneness of Humanity”, it promotes the idea that what unifies mankind is more fundamental than what separates us and that mutual understanding and dialogue lead to greater tolerance gradually considering the well-being of others as our own.

company.name: African Foundation for International Law-Fondation Africaine pour le Droit International

volunteer_experiences.description:
I provide advisory and executive services in respect of specific projects of the Foundation.  I coordinate the work of other volunteers and interns and serve as their mentors, as required.
One of our successful achievements in 2017 was the organization in The Hague of an event titled Working visit and International Judges Dialogue which brought together Chief Justices and representatives of select highest judicial institutions from African and sitting judges and senior officials of Hague-based international legal and judicial institutions (such as the International Court of Justice, the Permanent Court of Arbitration, the International Criminal Court, the Special Tribunal for Lebanon, etc.). The event offered unparalleled fora for high level exchanges on topics such as the peaceful settlement of interstate disputes, international criminal justice and the future of accountability mechanisms, the role of The Hague Conference on private international law as the world organization for cross-border cooperation in civil and commercial matters, etc.
The event was organized in collaboration with The Hague Project Peace and Justice, with the support of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Municipality of The Hague.

volunteer_experiences.role: Member,  Reflection Panel on new integration strategy
volunteer_experiences.description: I sit in working groups put together by the Municipality of The Hague in order to reflect on its new strategy ("Den Haag zijn we met z'n allen") for the improvement of the integration of new comers with a migrant background.
